title: Instant Pot Pinto Beans (No Soaking) Recipe
description: This easy recipe for Instant Pot pinto beans requires no soaking! Just pop the beans in your multi-functional pressure cooker and let them cook.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Beans and Peas Instant Pot Pinto Beans (No Soaking) 4.9 (85) 79 Reviews 8 Photos These Instant Pot pinto beans are super flavorful and easy. Submitted by Jim Updated on October 23, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 slices bacon 4 cups chicken broth 1 pound dried pinto beans, rinsed 1 ½ cups water ½ cup chopped onions, or to taste (Optional) 2 green chile peppers 1 ¼ teaspoons garlic powder 1 ¼ teaspoons kosher salt 1 teaspoon chili powder ½ teaspoon ground cumin ½ teaspoon paprika Directions Gather the ingredients. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Sauté function. Add bacon and cook, turning once, 4 to 6 minutes. Add chicken broth, pinto beans, water, onions, chile peppers, garlic powder, salt, chili powder, cumin, and paprika. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 45 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove bacon and chile peppers; chop to desired consistency and return to the pot. Mash beans with a potato masher until they reach desired consistency. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 236 Calories 3g Fat 39g Carbs 15g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 236 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 3% Saturated Fat 1g 3% Cholesterol 7mg 2% Sodium 973mg 42% Total Carbohydrate 39g 14% Dietary Fiber 9g 34% Total Sugars 3g Protein 15g 29% Vitamin C 32mg 36% Calcium 73mg 6% Iron 3mg 18% Potassium 880mg 19% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Pinto Beans (No Soaking) 01 of 08 Photo by  Jeanna Valenzuela-Johnson 02 of 08 Photo by  ShinyFrog8751 02/01/2024 Loved the recipe and actually followed the directions. I would certainly make them again. I didn’t mash them because I like to eat the beans whole and I added a little cilantro. 03 of 08 Photo by  Jeanna Valenzuela-Johnson 09/02/2023 Yum!! Absolutely the best beans and so easy too. 04 of 08 Photo by  SunnyTaro6692 08/28/2022 I went a little Nuevo here as I was making these beans to make enchiladas. I left out the green chili and cumin. I used a ground New Mexican red chili powder for the chili powder. I also just put a teaspoon of all the spices. 05 of 08 Photo by  jeremymongold 01/27/2022 I only cooked for 22 minutes as recommended on my Instant Pot chart. I didn’t want to mash them so didn’t need to cook as long. Second time making this recipe and it’s awesome! I normally make some white rice to pour the beans over. They’d probably be good on bread, cornbread or by themselves. 06 of 08 Photo by  Anne 05/31/2020 07 of 08 Photo by  Ms Tall Lady 02/15/2020 I will definitely make this recipe again! The seasoning was perfect as written. My family loves everything bacon, so leaving it in was a no-brainer. I just chopped it before the sauté step, which gave us bacon with every bite. I didn't have a chile pepper, so I added about 2 tablespoons of chopped green chiles from a can. This turned out to be a great decision. Thanks for the recipe! 08 of 08 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 09/20/2019 Made as written and these were excellent! I honestly expected them to be under cooked but they were perfect. The last step calls for mashing to desired consistency so I'm wondering if these were intended to be refried beans? I left them as is straight out of the IP and we enjoyed them very much. 1 You’ll Also Love Instant Pot Refried Beans 24 Ratings Instant Pot® Cuban-Style Black Beans 42 Ratings Refried Beans Without the Refry 2,604 Ratings Instant Pot Mexican Quinoa 17 Ratings Vegetarian Refried Beans 151 Ratings Easy Black Beans and Tomatoes 15 Ratings Rush Hour Refried Beans 67 Ratings Instant Pot Charro (Refried Beans) 79 Ratings Pinto Beans Muy Facil 12 Ratings Frijoles 27 Ratings Fat-Free Refried Beans 124 Ratings Frijoles II 44 Ratings Refried Black Beans 23 Ratings Chef John's Refried Beans 87 Ratings Slow Cooker Charro Beans 6 Ratings Kiki's Borracho (Drunken) Beans 220 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jim
instructions: Gather the ingredients.;Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Sauté function. Add bacon and cook, turning once, 4 to 6 minutes.;Add chicken broth, pinto beans, water, onions, chile peppers, garlic powder, salt, chili powder, cumin, and paprika. Close and lock the lid.;Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 45 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.;Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.;Remove bacon and chile peppers; chop to desired consistency and return to the pot. Mash beans with a potato masher until they reach desired consistency.
